body:
r? @huonw

(rust_highfive has picked a reviewer for you, use r? to override)
cc @Gankro particularly for the RawVec changes.

I idly wonder if this will slow the typedarena down noticably: it is adding an extra allocation (the `Vec` of chunks) and more indirection to get to the elements of the last chunk (have to index the vector and then dereference, instead of just a straight dereference).

That said I imagine it's not noticable.
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #28287) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.

\o/ for RawVec helping out even more!

All the RawVec-internal stuff seems good, but I don't have the bandwidth to review the Arena stuff, sadly :(
Thanks. Changes are pushed.
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #28306) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #28610) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #29026) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
Updated

``````
rustc: x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu/stage2/test/arenatest-x86_64-unknown-linux-gnu

src/libarena/lib.rs:610:29: 610:59 error: box expression syntax is experimental; you can call `Box::new` instead. (see issue #27779)

src/libarena/lib.rs:610             let _: Box<_> = box Point { x: 1, y: 2, z: 3 };

                                                    ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

src/libarena/lib.rs:610:29: 610:59 help: add #![feature(box_syntax)] ```to the crate attributes to enable

error: aborting due to previous error

``````
Corrected
:umbrella: The latest upstream changes (presumably #30017) made this pull request unmergeable. Please resolve the merge conflicts.
Rebased

The RawVec changes look good to me, except I think reserve in place should use the current reserve's growth strategy.

There's a lot of tricky code in the arenas, I'd love if someone else could read it through as well. It looks good, an overflow case needs to be handled.

I can't find any tests for Arena or TypedArena that actually checks that drops are called for the values within? So that would be a great thing to have. Check drops after regular out of scope, on .clear() and on panic.
It would be heroic to update all the stale comments in the file too, it seems there were a lot present before the PR.

It's finished, @bluss. There's maybe one stale comment left.

I'd like to split the module into `arena.rs` and `typed_arena.rs` when it's ready to be merged.

- :tada: heroic comment cleanup
- :tada: drop tests

Looks ready to me, others very welcome to look through it too
Do you know if this impacts rustc performance?

@bluss 

It should not.
Only a few arenas are used in typeck and trans. Performance difference should be hardly measurable.
Great, but it's the only use this code gets so far, right?
@bors r+

:pushpin: Commit 388e6af has been approved by `bluss`

<!-- @bors r=bluss 388e6afa1db74637169dcb65b1720c5e2f73c1d5 -->
Finally :balloon: :tada:
FYI, this code was [extracted into a crate](https://github.com/SimonSapin/rust-typed-arena), which I happen to use. You may want to see if some of the gains for `TypedArena` apply there.
Hm, did you want to split the file? I noticed the commits were consolidated, didn't think about more pre merge cleanup than that. Either way is fine and r=me (from any reviewer).
I'd like to extract and deprecate Arena instead. It hasn't been in use by rustc for an entire year.
:hourglass: Testing commit 388e6af with merge 143f484...
I already modified `rust-typed-arena` as much as I could without adding unsafe code.

@pczarn great, I appreciate that! Although **I'm** totally cool with it having well-tested unsafe code ;-) I could always do some head-to-head perf testing between the two implementations to see if it's useful.
@bluss: It's deprecated. :shipit: :tada:
Nominating for libs team discussion re: deprecation.
**Libs team consensus**: the deprecation here isn't really relevant, as the crate is already gated by `rustc_private`.

Thank you @aturon. Let's go again!

@bors r+

:pushpin: Commit e2ccc4f has been approved by `bluss`

<!-- @bors r=bluss e2ccc4f744b93f89666fe4c8828905297bb76178 -->

:confetti_ball: 

Thanks so much for persevering on this, @pczarn!
